732382f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food.
732382f-a.text:
A green vegetable vendor near First Ave., and 110th Street.
August 31, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

707705f-b.text:
(1)
First Avenue, north from and including 110th Street, showing Jefferson Park on the east side from 111th to 114th Streets.
May 23, 1934.
L. Sperr.
(2)
Detail of the above, giving a better view of Jefferson Park. The church in the background is on 114th Street east of First Avenue. JJefferson Park was laid out about 1900, at which time the old houses on the east side of First Avenue
were demolished.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

707705f-a.text:

731616f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731616f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Parade, a group carrying candelabra, passing the west side of First Avenue between 111th
and 110th Streets.
The gas tank belongs to the Consolidated Gas Company.
Ju1Y 1o, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
1 r 2
244-  eR,22  iE
(2)
Parade, crossing First Avenue at 114th Street. Two fine votive candelabra, towers built up of small oandles, are being carried
by the individuals in this picture.
July lo, 1w29.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
People walking about and crowding the booths on 115th Street, which is all decorated for the feast. The view is east from First Avenue; the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel is shown
near the corner of Pleasant avenue.
July 16, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

and 110th Street, an Italian section.

P. L. Sperr.
